mission.title: Mission
mission.content: The Digital Folklore Archive is a project dedicated to collecting, preserving, and cataloging contemporary folklore born on the internet from an academic perspective. We aim to preserve digital-age folkloric materials—including kaidan, urban legends, creepypasta, and chain messages—for future generations.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.content: Each item is annotated with source information, approximate first appearance date, and reliability rating. Links to original sources are provided whenever possible. When multiple versions exist, revision history is recorded to enable tracking textual changes over time.

contribution.title: Contribution
contribution.content: We welcome community contributions including new material submissions, error corrections, and translation assistance. You can propose new items through the submission page.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: For questions or suggestions, please reach out through our GitHub repository's Issues.
